--- In cantera@yahoogroups.com, "yarmond" <yarmond@...> wrote:
>
> I had a =
similar problem installing Cantera on a 64-bit Ubuntu system,
> and found t=
hat compiling Sundials with -fPIC solved my problems, i.e.
> run the config=
ure script for sundials with the options
> --with-cflags=3D-fPIC --with-cpp=
flags=3D-fPIC
> 
> --- In cantera@yahoogroups.com, "Mirko" <mvukovic@> wrot=
e:
> >
> > Hi,
> > 
> > I downloaded cantera 1.7.0 yesterday from sourcefor=
ge.
> > 
> > I get an error when running "make python-install" with the mes=
sage
> > that I need to recompile with -fPIC.
> > 
> > I have seen several =
emails with the same topic.  But some of them
> > indicate that the problem=
 was resolved in version 1.7.1.  Where can I
> > find that version (I looke=
d briefly at the CVS and did not see
> > anything newer than 1.7, except fo=
r Makefile.in)?
> > 
> > (I am not super-comfortable modifying the makefile=
s, but with clear
> > enough instructions I am willing to do it).
> > 
> > =
In case it is of relevance, I think I have 64-bit python, simply
> > becaus=
e my python2.4 sits in the /usr/lib64 directory.  (It came
> > pre-installe=
d)
> > 
> > Thank you very much,
> > 
> > Mirko
> >
>
I took one more look =
at the various emails, and decided to explicitly
add the -fPIC option to th=
e CXXFLAGS in preconfig.  I then cleaned up
and re-built and re-installed e=
verything:

make
sudo make install
make python
sudo make python-install

No=
w make test passes.

Mirko
